intro: Ligusticum deltoideum, commonly known as delta lovage, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. It is often cultivated for its fragrant leaves and roots, which have been used in traditional medicine. Ligusticum deltoideum thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
